snippet: The system, which requires airlines to account for all of their emissions on flights involving European airports, is the Union's boldest move to date to protect the climate.
abstract: European Commission says it will continue charging airlines for their greenhouse gas emissions, despite an announcement from China that its carriers will be forbidden to pay without its permission; system is Europe's boldest move to date to protect against global warming.
lead_paragraph: The system, which requires airlines to account for all of their emissions on flights involving European airports, is the Union's boldest move to date to protect the climate.

headline.main: E.U. Rebuffs China's Challenge to Airline Emission System
headline.print_headline: Europe Refuses to Budge on Airline Emissions Fee
